Traditional and modern biotechnology. Topics include fermentation processes, medical, agricultural and forensic applications; as well as gene cloning and expression.

course_description: Physical chemistry as applied to biological sciences. Introductory thermodynamics, kinetics, equilibria, and transport phenomena as applied to proteins, biological membranes and other biological systems. Laboratory work includes kinetic measurements, equilibrium constant measurements and protein purification and characterization.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): CHEM 1P91 and 1P92 (1F92); one of MATH 1P01 and 1P02, MATH 1P05 and 1P06 (preferred), or MATH 1P97.

course_description: Fermentation technology and bioprocessing; the kinetics and thermodynamics of fermentation. Topics include batch and continuous fermentation, biomass production (single-cell proteins), immobilized systems, by-product recovery and scale-up.
prerequisites: Notes: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Fermentation technology and bioprocessing; the kinetics and thermodynamics of fermentation. Topics include batch and continuous fermentation, biomass production (single-cell proteins), immobilized systems, by-product recovery and scale-up.

course_description: Topics include the genetic code and information flow from nucleic acids to proteins, RNA and protein synthesis; prokaryotic and eukaryotic chromosomes; gene organization; transcription, RNA processing; codon usage; enhancer and transposons.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): BIOL 2P02 and 2P03 (2F01) or permission of the instructor.
instructor: Instructor: Necakov, Aleksandar / Ciolfi, John / Despres, Charles

course_description: Mechanistic description of the biosynthesis and metabolism of natural products including alkaloids, terpenes and acetate-derived compounds. Selected examples of biologically/medicinally active classes of natural products along with their physiological modes of activity.
prerequisites: Crosslisting: also offered as CHEM 3P62

course_description: Chemistry and structure of nucleic acids, proteins and carbohydrates. Selected aspects of chemical synthesis and biosynthesis, including mechanisms of protein folding, post-translational modification, targeting, sequencing, detection techniques and biochemical/medical applications of these molecules.
prerequisites: Crosslisting: also offered as CHEM 3P93

course_description: Experimental research carried out under faculty supervision.
prerequisites: Crosslisting: also offered as CHEM 3P93

course_description: Experimental research carried out under faculty supervision.
prerequisites: Crosslisting: also offered as CHEM 3P93

course_description: Incorporates results of the research project and will form the basis of a seminar presented by the student.
prerequisites: Notes: Open only to majors. See course description for re strictions list. Approval to Year IV (honours) is required. this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Sequence analysis, phylogeny, databases and tools, functional genomics, genome project, basic bioformatics programming.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): BTEC 3P50, BIOL 3P51 or permission of the instructor.

course_description: Characterization of biochemical processes and structures. Genetic modification of such processes and structures through molecular manipulation to meet scientific and/or societal needs. Examples include yeast and microbial enzymes or enzyme systems as well as crop proteins and enzymes.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): one of BTEC 3P50, 3P93, BCHM 3P01, 3P02, BIOL 2P94 or permission of the instructor.
instructor: Instructor: Dano, Jacinta / De Luca, Vincenzo

course_description: Characterization of biochemical processes and structures. prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): one of BTEC 3P50, 3P93, BCHM 3P01, 3P02, BIOL 2P94 or permission of the instructor.

course_name: Theory of Technqs in Biochem & Molecular Biol
course_description: Theory behind basic and some advanced techniques in nucleic acid and protein manipulations and analysis.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): BTEC 3P50.

course_description: Technological and engineering advances in the biological sciences, along with tools and discoveries stemming from them. Induced pluripotent stem cells, CRISPR/Cas9-based genome editing, optogenetic control of cellular communication, engineering the immune response, programmable DNA-based materials and engineered biosensors.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): one of BTEC 3P50, BCHM 3P01, BIOL 3P51.

course_description: Waste-management technologies that utilize biological agents (such as micro-organisms and plants) to treat hazardous contaminants and produce biocommodities. Biological, biogeochemical and engineering concepts in the design of technologies.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): open to students holding 15 or more credits.

course_description: Principles of toxicology. Key enzymes involved in the metabolism and biotransformation of xenobiotics. Actions of xenbiotics on nucleic acids, proteins and lipids. Biochemical mechanisms of the toxicity of selected xenobiotics such as toxins, common toxic chemicals, drugs and pesticides. Identification of xenobiotics in biological systems.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): CHEM 2P21 or permission of the instructor.

course_description: Hydrolytic and other processes catalyzed by enzymes lacking non-protein prosthetic groups; transferase reactions involving biotin, pyridoxal phosphate, thiamine pyrophosphate, folic acid and cobalamin; oxidation mechanisms involving pyridine nucleotides, flavoenzymes, hydroperoxidases and oxygenases.
prerequisites: Crosslisting: also offered as CHEM 4P27

course_description: Topics include mono and oligosaccharides, preparative carbohydrate chemistry, neoglycoconjugates, immunochemistry of carbohydrates, nucleosides and nucleotides, oligonucleotide synthesis, medicinal chemistry of oligonucleotides, amino acids, protein structures, peptide chemistry and post-translational modifications.
prerequisites: Crosslisting: also offered as CHEM 4P28

course_description: Principles of human genetics, human genome organization, pedigree, disease gene mapping, forensic and cancer genetics, genome sequencing, personal genomics.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): BTEC 3P50 or BIOL 3P51.

course_description: Examination of various aspects of RNA (ribonucleic acid) function and evolution. Examination of evidence that RNA precedes DNA as the hereditary material and played a crucial role in the early evolution of life on Earth.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): BTEC 3P50 or BCHM 3P02.

course_description: Bacterial and animal viruses. Topics include biochemical properties, virus-host interaction, productive cycle, effect of virus on host cell and organism, viral vectors and gene therapy, recombinant viral vaccines and origin of virus.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): BTEC 3P50 or permission of the instructor.

course_description: Modern instrumental methods of biotechnology emphasizing understanding theory. Development of newer technologies which utilize biological components. Topics include optical, X-ray and NMR techniques, separation techniques, hybridization assays, immunoassays, biosensors and mass spectral techniques; membrane chemistry.
prerequisites: Crosslisting: also offered as BCHM 4P67 and CHEM 4P67
instructor: Instructor: Van Der Est, Arthur J
